result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Samuel Franklin

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated October 15, 2022; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Joel Samuel Franklin appeared by video.  Attorney Mindy M. Nolan appeared by video for Joel Samuel Franklin. Attorney Annie Louk appeared on behalf of  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Court reviewed Defense's request to adjourn. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update to the Court regarding request to adjourn. State did not object. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 16.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Letter to Court -Requesting Adjournment
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-22-22
Pretrial Services Status Report
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    MINDY NOLAN   $1,360.00
Of attorney fees and costs due to Milwaukee County

Defendant Joel Samuel Franklin in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises they are in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-4-22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 7-28-22

Defendant Joel Samuel Franklin in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state, but needs additional time to speak with client. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference, and sets 08/03/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16. Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-30-22

Defendant Joel Samuel Franklin in court with Attorney Mindy M. Nolan; both appear by video.  Stephanie Krueger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-25-22

Defendant Joel Samuel Franklin in court in person with Attorney Mindy M. Nolan who appears by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Nolan is newly appointed and needs time to meet with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-18-22

22RM019761  Actual Date Bond Posted with *Sheriff
4/9/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Joel Samuel Franklin in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Joel Samuel Franklin in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
